questions.question: Vermin ………………….. our property and carry disease.
questions.description: Though vermin is singular in form, it is always used as a plural noun.

questions.question: Whose cattle ……………………?
questions.description: Though cattle is singular in form, it is always used as a plural noun.

questions.question: His means ………………….. small, but he has no debt.
questions.description: When means is used with the meaning of wealth, it is always plural.

questions.question: A new means of communication ……………………….. invented in the 19th century.
questions.description: Both the singular and the plural of means end in –s.

questions.question: I bought two ………………….. mangoes.
questions.description: When dozen is used after a number, it does not have a plural form.

questions.question: Man is the only animal that …………………….. fire.
questions.description: Here the antecedent of the relative pronoun is a singular noun (animal) and hence we use the singular verb uses.

questions.question: Hunting tigers ……………………… a favorite sport in this country.
questions.description: Here the subject is the gerund phrase hunting tigers. It is singular.

questions.question: There ……………………. little hope of his recovery.
questions.description: Hope is a singular noun hence we use is.

questions.question: Every one of these chairs ……………………. broken.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after every one.

questions.question: He visits us every ……………………….
questions.description: We use a singular noun after every.

questions.question: He visits us every three ………………….
questions.description: A plural noun is used after every + numeral.

questions.question: A house divided against …………………… cannot stand.
questions.description: Here the subject and the object refer to the same thing and hence we use the reflexive pronoun itself.
